div1.p: Thanks, many times over, for yesterday's treasured hour at your house. The gracious welcome felt as warm as the glowing fire. Dr. Sandall and I learned so much from each one of you. It is indubitally true that the Poet makes all men see.
WE appreciate your time and concern. Especially do we appreciate the autographs, Dr. Neihardt. Generations yet to be will honor these volumes!
I have sent a memo to the office regarding the painting and trust you will soon be hearing about it.
Mr. Dalrymple, our Director, will be officially acknowledging the gift of Mr. House's "John G. Neihardt, Man and Poet" but I extend my personal gratitude also.
We are so excited over the possiblity of the gift of "The Divine Enchantment," and would assure you that the Nebraska Author Collection is a permanent one.
We are getting nearer and nearer a complete colleciton of our Laureate's works!
Now we look foward to welcoming you in the McKelvie Room and introducing you to our distinguished Nebraska Authors.
Dr. Sandall joins his gratitude with mine.
